name: Blueheart
description:
Blueheart is inventing fully-automated digital sex therapy to help the hundreds of millions of people across the world that face sexual dysfunction. With a team whose Engineering wing comprises of 2 Cambridge graduates in Computer Science and Mathematics, the Business side managed by Sachin with a background in technology product management (UCL Dean's List & Cambridge) plus one of the world's foremost sex therapists, Dr Kat Hertlein, who wrote the seminal textbook for clinicians of sexual therapy, Blueheart's team is incredibly well placed to solve this issue.

We're transforming how humans connect with each other to live beautiful lives with the people they love. Most importantly, we don't want anyone to feel alone when facing sexual issues that often carry shame & embarrassment. 

We're out there on the App & Play stores and have been revenue generating since Month 1. 

We're on a crusade to make sex therapy affordable, accessible and embarrassment free by harnessing technology in an innovative way to change the world for the better. 

If you connect with our message, please get in touch. We love to hear from anyone and everyone. Message us at hello@blueheart.io

team.name: Sachin Raoul
team.bioHtml: CEO at Blueheart. Graduate from UCL (Dean's List) & Cambridge. Half creative, half pragmatist.

jobs.title: In-House Therapist
jobs.description:
**What You'll Be Doing**


The In-House Therapist is our connection to the people we’re helping. They will have 2 key roles - the first is to speak directly to users and support them in their difficult situations. The second is to work with the content team to create the sex therapy plans delivered through the app. You'll be working directly with world-renowned sex therapist and the Editor-in-Chief of the Journal of Couples and Relationship Therapy, Dr Kat Hertlein whom will guide you in your role.

*Your core tasks will involve:
*
speaking to people about their issues to get them comfortable with Blueheart and alleviate their fears or confusions. 

Take feedback from people to find out what they do and don’t like with the app, to create the strategy for the product team

Support the content team in the creation of in-app content (therapy plans etc…)


**Your Impact**


Given that you’ll be interacting directly with people in their time of need, you’ll be the one having a direct impact on their lives. You’ll most likely be the first person they’ve ever spoken to about these problems, so your ability to make them feel comfortable will be paramount to your success. You'll experience the impact of your work immediately, as people will tell you personally how much you've helped them.


**Culture**


We trust the people we work with. You'll be given a huge amount of responsibility shaping the treatment plans as well as your user conversations. We take an open approach to new ideas and believe in testing and experimentation with small feedback loops. If you're dying for freedom for your brilliance to run free and completely change social norms around sex in innovative ways - this is the place for you.

**Skills**


* Registered or Accredited Member of CORST, but this is not essential if you have completed relevant CPD in working with sexual issues and have a strong background in assisting with psychosexual issues with your clients.  

* Able to quickly connect with and respond to users' emotional and informational needs without face-to-face interaction

* Knowledge of working within the BACP's ethical framework (or equivalent framework from another major professional body)

* Evidence of a strong academic background - we're seeking someone who can support us in using the available academic literature to help us ensure that the product's features have a strong evidence-base

* 200 or more client hours practiced

* The ability to assess client risk and safeguarding issues - we don't expect there to be a great need for this in our work, but we want to ensure we are prepared for circumstances where we are concerned about a client's welfare

* Experience in offering emotional support over the phone or online (webchat/e-mail) is highly desirable

* Demonstrative enthusiasm for the potential for digital therapy as a way to increase access to therapy, and willingness to think outside traditional approaches to therapy to ensure our product is informed by a diverse knowledge base

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager
jobs.description:
We’ve had a rollercoaster of a ride so far, having gone through Preseed and Seed investment rounds of £1.12m in 6 months. We've proven that a change needs to happen and we’re the team to do it. We’re a small but smart team where information and data informs decisions, not meaningless hierarchies. You have an idea? Great, test it and prove your point.


Our mission is to make sex therapy affordable, accessible and shame-free for everyone. For decades, therapy has been accessible only to those who can afford it, who live in cities and who muster enough confidence to seek help. We want to open sex therapy to anyone feeling isolated, alone and scared. So if you think the state of human sex is all fucked up, you're in the right place.

**What We're Looking For**

An exceptional Product Manager with a strong quantitative background, to sit on the bridge of the Enterprise. As an early hire, we're looking for people in this for the long term to become an integral part of the company as we grow.


**You'll Be Responsible For:**

Defining product direction alongside the founders

Conduct and analyse incredible user tests

Using a methodical approach to identify and prioritise the most critical product problems

Manage and organise product stakeholders across design, engineering and content for co-ordinated and timely delivery

Digging deep into our data to develop critical understanding and communicate this with the team.


**Your Impact**

The impact this will have cannot be overstated. If you’ve gone through a break-up (like everyone) you will know how damaging this can be on one’s mental health. If you’re successful in the role, you will be saving the marriages & relationships of millions of people who have no where to turn and nobody to talk to. This comes with a lot of responsibility, but the upside is people will tell you that you saved them from the darkest moments in their life.


**Culture**

We trust the people we work with and you’ll be working directly with the founders' who are ready to give you ownership of the product funnel. We’re all about experimenting, seeing results and improving. If you’ve got a wild idea that you think might work, you’ll get one response - ‘Do it, and let’s see the results’.


**Skills**

5 years+ experience in product manager roles in consumer tech (3 years minimum)

Flawless academic track record with a bachelors' quantitative degree (Psychology, economics, computer science etc...)

Working knowledge of SQL

Working knowledge of prototyping tools desired (XD, Sketch, InVision etc...)
